item.title: Margarita
item.description:
If you’re feeling extra adventurous, muddle one or two slices of jalapeño in your shaker before adding the ingredients.
  • 2 oz tequila
  • ¾ oz orange liqueur
  • ¾ oz lime juice
  • ¼ oz agave syrup
  • 1 pinch of salt
Shake vigorously with ice. Strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.

item.title: Cherry on Top
item.description:
• 6 fresh cherries, pitted
  • 1½ oz vodka
  • ½ oz Luxardo Maraschino
  • ¾ oz lemon juice
  • ¼ oz simple syrup
Muddle five cherries in the bottom of your cocktail shaker. Add the liquids and ice. Shake.

Double strain into a Collins glass filled with ice. Set a cherry atop the ice as a garnish.

item.title: Bannon Tantrum
item.description:
“The media should keep its mouth shut and just listen for awhile”—Steve Bannon throwing a tantrum on Jan 26, 2017

This must be made with Dry Fly brand vodka; It has an amazing wheat flavor and I created this recipe specifically to highlight it.

  • 2 oz Dry Fly vodka
  • ½ oz meyer lemon juice
  • ½ oz simple syrup
Add everything to a shaker with ice. Shake. Strain into a rocks glass over ice.

item.title: Indian Winter
item.description:
This uses honey syrup infused with cardomom pods.
  • 1½ oz vodka
  • ½ oz lemon juice
  • ½ oz honey cardamom syrup
  • 1 egg white
  • 2 drops Angostura bitters
  • 1 star anise
Add vodka, lemon juice, syrup, and egg white to a shaker. Dry shake, then add ice and shake. Double-strain into a coupe glass.

Add a couple drops of Angostura bitters on top of the foam (for aroma). Float the star anise atop the drink.

item.title: Bees Knees
item.description:
• 2 oz gin
  • ¾ oz lemon juice
  • ¾ oz honey syrup
  • lemon twist
Add gin, lemon juice, and honey syrup to a cocktail shaker. Shake. Strain into coupe glass.

Garnish with lemon twist.

item.title: Blanc-arita
item.description:
• 2 oz silver tequila
  • ½ oz blanc vermouth
  • ½ oz lime juice
  • ½ oz agave syrup
  • 1 dash orange bitters
Shake vigorously with ice. Strain into rocks glass over fresh ice.

item.title: Blushing Betty
item.description:
• 1½ oz bourbon
  • 1 oz grapefruit juice
  • ½ oz simple syrup
  • grapefruit twist
Shake vigorously with ice. Strain into rocks glass over fresh ice.

Garnish with grapefruit twist.

item.title: Brandy Alexander
item.description:
• 2 oz Cognac or other brandy
  • 1 oz heavy cream
  • ½ oz demerara syrup
  • fresh grated nutmeg
Add brandy, cream, and demerara syrup to a cocktail shaker. Shake. Strain into coupe glass.

Top with grated nutmeg.

item.title: Daiquiri
item.description:
• 2 oz white rum
  • ¾ oz lime juice
  • ¾ oz simple syrup
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with plenty of ice. Shake well and strain into a coupe glass.

item.title: Maple Leaf
item.description:
The recipe where I found this drink said, “drink on a porch with an old dog.” It’s solid advice.
  • 2 oz bourbon
  • ¾ oz real maple syrup
  • ¾ oz lemon juice
  • cinnamon stick
Shake vigorously with ice. Strain into rocks glass over crushed ice.

Garnish with cinnamon stick.

item.title: Vigo
item.description:
I didn’t invent this drink, but I did invent the name.
  • 2 oz orange juice
  • 1 oz London dry gin
  • 1 oz blanc vermouth
  • ¼ oz honey syrup
  • 2 oz sparkling wine
Add all ingredients except the sparkling wine to a cocktail shaker with plenty of ice. Shake then strain into a wine glass. Top with the sparkling wine. Be disappointed by Mimosas for the rest of your life.

item.title: Sidecar
item.description:
The simple syrup isn’t traditional, but that’s how I learned it, and I like the touch of additional sweetness.
  • 2 oz Cognac
  • ¾ oz orange liqueur
  • ¾ oz lemon juice
  • ¼ oz simple syrup
  • orange twist, discarded
Shake vigorously with ice. Strain into a coupe glass.

Express the oils from an orange twist over the drink, then discard the peel.
